Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup; interior: reserved band below rim, glazed black below, with narrow band in added white near bottom of sherd; top of rim glazed exterior: on lip black-figure decoration consisting of squatting satyr (most of head now lost) to right, with tail and hair in added red; below, black band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For masturbating satyrs see P. Heesen and M. Iozzo, Athenian Black-figure Cups from the Campana Collection, 2019, 78, n.163.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 389, no. B557)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0559) (Phase 1)
